Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has been watered and looks healthy.
The student can draw a plant that has not been watered and looks unhealthy (e.g., wilting or dry).
The student can show in their drawing that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can use labels or descriptions to show the differences between the plants with water and without water.
The student can identify patterns in their drawings that show how plants change with and without water.
